catalog_info.title: The Urban Imagination
catalog_info.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Aesthetic and Interpretive Understanding.
catalog_info.description: Cities are one of humankind's most richly complex inventions and can best be understood through both creative and critical thinking. Offered in connection with a Mellon-funded initiative in Architecture, Urbanism, and the Humanities, this course invites you to join an interdisciplinary investigation of the urban form and fabric, socio-cultural life, and artistic representation of five iconic cities — Boston, Berlin, Moscow, Istanbul, and Mumbai. We will treat literature, film, and photography alongside cultural history, experiment with urban fieldwork, and use digital tools for mapping and curating virtual exhibitions.
